Package apcs.playList

Class PlayList

java.lang.Object
apcs.playList.PlayList
public class PlayList
extends java.lang.Object
A Java class that manages a playlist of songs. Each song has a title and records the number of times it has been played. The class provides methods to add songs to a playlist, retrieve/print the playlist, change songs, and remove songs (among other functions). By JP and Sidd

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    PlayList​(int capacity)
    Creates a new instance of PlayList with a specified capacity Precondition: capacity is greater than 0, and less than the max array size limit.

    Loops through the songs array, locating the song that you are searching for and returning its index.
    java.lang.String play​(int indexOfRequestedSong)
    "Plays" a song that is located at the requested index Preconditions: The requested index is in the playlist Postconditions: Increments the number of plays for that song by 1
    void remove​(int indexOfRequestedSong)
    Removes a song and its number of plays from the playlist Preconditions: The requested index must be less than the size of the playlist or greater than or equal to 0 Postconditions: Removes one from the songs and plays array and decrements size by 1

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayList

      public PlayList​(int capacity)
      Creates a new instance of PlayList with a specified capacity Precondition: capacity is greater than 0, and less than the max array size limit. Postcondition: Initializes songs as a new array of Strings of size capacity, initializes plays as a new array of ints size capacity, sets size to 0.
      Parameters:
      capacity - the total capacity of the playlist

  • Method Details

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the current effective size (the value of the size instance variable)
      Returns:
      current effective size

    • capacity

      public int capacity()
      Returns the current effective capacity based on the length of the songs Array
      Returns:
      current effective capacity

    • add

      public void add​(java.lang.String newSong)
      Adds a song to the array, checking if there is room in the array for the new value (if not, expands the array). Sets the appropriate element of the songs array to the passed song name parameter so that the new song name is added to the "end" of the list. Then increments size by 1 to reflect the new list size. Postcondition: Adds the song to the array, sets the corresponding plays to 0, and increments size by 1
      Parameters:
      newSong - name of the song to be added to the list

    • add

      public void add​(int indexOfRequestedSong, java.lang.String newSong)
      Similar to the other add method, but accepts an index for where the requested song is to be added. Precondition: The index for where the requested song is to be added should be no more than the index of an array 1.5x the original size of the array. Postcondition: The new song is added to the requested index.
      Parameters:
      indexOfRequestedSong - the index of the requested song
      newSong - the string of the new song being added
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException - when the array index is < 0 or >= the list size

    • getSong

      public java.lang.String getSong​(int indexOfRequestedSong)
      Returns the song stored at the requested index Precondition: The requested index is in the playlist
      Parameters:
      indexOfRequestedSong - the index of the requested song
      Returns:
      the song at the requested index
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException - when the array index is < 0 or >= the list size

    • getPlays

      public int getPlays​(int indexOfRequestedSong)
      Gets the number of plays from the index of a requested song.
      Parameters:
      indexOfRequestedSong - the index of the requested song
      Returns:
      number of plays from the index of a requested song
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException - when the array index is < 0 or >= the list size

    • play

      public java.lang.String play​(int indexOfRequestedSong)
      "Plays" a song that is located at the requested index Preconditions: The requested index is in the playlist Postconditions: Increments the number of plays for that song by 1
      Parameters:
      indexOfRequestedSong - the index of the requested song
      Returns:
      The song name of the song at the requested index
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException - when the array index is < 0 or >= the list size

    • indexOf

      public int indexOf​(java.lang.String songName)
      Loops through the songs array, locating the song that you are searching for and returning its index.
      Parameters:
      songName - the name of the song you are finding the index of
      Returns:
      the index of the found song, or -1 if the song cannot be found

    • remove

      public void remove​(int indexOfRequestedSong)
      Removes a song and its number of plays from the playlist Preconditions: The requested index must be less than the size of the playlist or greater than or equal to 0 Postconditions: Removes one from the songs and plays array and decrements size by 1
      Parameters:
      indexOfRequestedSong - index of requested song
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException - when the array index is < 0 or >= the list size

    • set

      public void set​(int indexOfRequestedSong, java.lang.String songName)
      Sets the value of the songs array stored at the index to the passed song name value
      Parameters:
      indexOfRequestedSong - index of requested song
      songName - the song name
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException - when the array index is < 0 or >= the list size

    • getFavorite

      public java.lang.String getFavorite()
      Returns the most played song Preconditions: The playlist must have something
      Returns:
      the name of the song with the most plays
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException - when the array index is < 0 or >= the list size
